newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RUGBY UNION-AUCKLAND RUN RIOT AGAINST GAUTENG.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-AUCKLAND RUN RIOT AGAINST GAUTENG.

text.p: The Auckland Blues ended the Gauteng Lions' two-year dominance over them with a resounding 63-22 win against the South Africans in a Super 12 rugby game on a wet Eden Park on Saturday.
The Blues started slowly but once they settled they were irresistible in a 10-tries-to-three victory to atone for their failure to beat Gauteng in their previous two encounters.
Auckland are unbeaten in the competition and retake the lead briefly taken by the ACT Brumbies on Friday.

Gauteng stunned the Super 12 champions with a fierce start which earned them two tries in the first 15 minutes, the first to flanker Warren Brosnahan and the second to an intercept by halfback Johan Roux.
Between the two, the Blues set up two quick rucks for halfback Ofisa Tonu'u to dart under the crossbar for a try which Carlos Spencer converted.
Roux converted his the try and then kicked a penalty from 23 metres to take Gauteng out to a 15-7 lead.

Auckland stormed back, first from a pushover try in the 21st minute to Zinzan Brooke which was converted by Spencer to narrow the gap to 14-15, and then from a series of rucks inside the Lions 22 where Brooke again ploughed over for a converted try.
Disaster struck Gauteng in the 32nd minute captain Kobus Wiese landed heavily and appeared to suffer a neck injury when attempting to tackle Lee Stensness.
Play was halted for seven minutes as a neckbrace was applied on Wiese, who was carried from the field on a stretcher.
Spencer goaled a penalty when play restarted before Auckland sent young lock Leo Lafaiali'i scampering over for his side's fourth try, which secured the bonus point before the halftime break.

Leading 29-15 at halftime, Auckland needed just three minutes in the second spell before adding to their tally when Brooke sent Tonu'u over for his second try of the game from a five metre scrum to make.
From there on, Auckland's superior speed told.
Tries by Joeli Vidiri, Spencer, replacement Dylan Mika, who came on for Lafaiali'i, flanker Michael Jones and finally replacement winger Jeremy Stanley all added to the Lions' humiliation.

Auckland Blues: 15-Shane Howarth, 14-Joeli Vidiri, 13-Eroni Clarke, 12-Lee Stensness, 11-Brian Lima (Jeremy Stanley), 10-Carlos Spencer, 9-Ofisa Tonu'u, 8-Zinzan Brooke (captain), 7-Mark Carter, 6-Michael Jones, 5-Jim Coe, 4-Leo Lafaiali'i (Dylan Mika), 3-Craig Dowd, 2-Sean Fitzpatrick,1-Paul Thomson.

Gauteng Lions: 15-Dawie du Toit, 14-Jannie van der Walt, 13-Japie Mulder, 12-Riaan van Jarsveld, 11-James Moss, 10-Hennie Le Roux, 9-Johan Roux, 8-Andre Vos, 7-Ian MacDonald, 6-Warren Brosnihan, 5-Hannes Strydom, 4-Kobus Wiese, 3-Kapstock van Greuning, 2-Chris Roussouw, 1-Balie Swart.
